title: [K-12] Instructional Design Process for Reflective Journaling to Develop Design Thinking and Professional Identity

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary mathematics education experience and understanding of basic instructional design concepts
context.additional_context: Conducting mathematics instructional design practice and reflective journaling activities using VR simulations in smartphone-centric limited technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can systematically solve mathematics instructional design problems by applying the design thinking process.
Learners can analyze their idea-generation process through reflective journaling and derive insights for developing professional identity.
Learners can iteratively improve instructional design solutions based on peer feedback in a VR simulation environment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
